1.q_string: A particle after starting from rest experiences constant acceleration for \(20 {~sec}\). If it covers a distance \(s_{1}\) in the first \(10 ~{sec}\), then the distance covered during the next \(10~ {sec}\) will be:
A particle when thrown moves such that it passes from the same height at \(2 {~s}\) and \(10 {~s}\), the height is:
A clock has a minute hand of length \(14~cm\). At what speed does the tip of the minute hand move in a duration of half an hour?
If the distance between the Earth and the Sun is half its present value, the number of days in a year will be
A man walks \(8~m\) towards the east and then \(6~m\) towards the north. The magnitude of his displacement is:
The acceleration (a) of a particle is plotted on the \(Y\)-axis while the time (t) elapsed is plotted along the X-axis. What does the a - t graph give?
A boy moves \(4 {~m}\) to the east then he turned left and moves \(12 {~m}\), after he climbs a pole to a height of \(3 {~m}\). Find the displacement of the boy.

The co-ordinates of moving particle at any time \(t\) are given as \(x=\alpha t^{3}\) and \(y=\beta t^{3}\). The Speed of the particle at \(t\) is given by: (where the letters have their usual meanings)

<font size="2" face="Arial"><font size="2" face="Arial">Three particles 'A', 'B' and 'C' are thrown from the top of a tower with the same speed. 'A' is thrown up, 'B' is thrown down and 'C' is thrown horizontally. If they hit the ground respectively with speeds 'V<sub>A</sub>', 'V<sub>B</sub>', and 'V<sub>C</sub>', then</font></font>
A particle has initial velocity \((2 \vec{\imath}+3 \vec{\jmath})\) and acceleration \((0.3 \vec{\imath}+0.2 \vec{\jmath})\). The magnitude of velocity after 10 seconds will be:
Angular displacement is:
A runner runs \(200 {~m}\), east, then changes direction and runs \(300 {~m}\), west. If the entire trip takes \(60~ {s}\), what will be the average velocity?
A car moves in a circular path of radius \(30 {~m}\) and takes \(5 {~sec}\) to reach the diametral end, then the average velocity of the car to reach the diametral end is:

A person traveling on a straight line moves with a uniform velocity \(v_{1}\) for a distance \(x\) and with a uniform velocity \(v_{2}\) for the next equal distance. The average velocity \(v\) is given by:
<font size="2" face="Arial"><font size="2" face="Arial">When an object moves an equal distance in equal intervals of time, its motion is said to be</font></font>

q_option: No frame of reference is required a single point will do.
No frame of reference is required ; a set of 3 points will do.
frame of reference consisting of a clock and a Cartesian coordinate system having three mutually perpendicular axes, labeled X-, Y-, and Z- axes
frame of reference consisting of a clock and a Cartesian coordinate system having two mutually perpendicular axes, labeled X-, and Y- axes
1.q_string: For motion in 3 dimensions we need
Displacement is a

q_option: is equal in not equal intervals of time.
is decreasing in equal intervals of time
is equal in equal intervals of time.
is increasing in equal intervals of time
1.q_string: An object is said to be in uniform motion in a straight line if its displacement

q_option: the change in position or displacement (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
the change in path length (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
the change in average distance from origin (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
the change in average path length (Δx) divided by the time intervals (Δt), in which the displacement occurs
